result.execSummary:
The defendant Velda M Brown was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Armed Robbery with Threat of Force, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: $154.00 to Arnold M.  To be paid first, before costs/fees and surcharges.

Court all costs, fees, restitution and surcharges and restitution. Bail on deposit to be applied towards restitution first, the costs/fees/surcharges second.
 To be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of funds/earnings.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

superMiscConds.notes:
Commit no new crimes.
No contact with Doris W., Arnold M. or the address of 6780 W. Lincoln Avenue.
No use or possession of firearms.
Maintain absolute sobriety from all illegal drugs and alcohol.

Comply with any medication regiment.
Provide notice of prescription medication to agent before filling it.

supervisions.notes:
Provide a DNA sample, pay DNA surcharge.
Court advised defendant that as  a convicted felon she may never possess any gun or other firearms; also advised that her voting rights are suspended and may not vote in any election until her civil rights are restored.

records.addlTxt: Order for Cancellation of Huber/Work Release/Electronic Surveillance Privileges Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes Section 303.08(2), 973.09(4), 973.03(4), signed and filed.
Bail  Refund Packets.
Restitution Packet
1/12/16 bail refund notice/affidavit mailed to surety.

Attorney Mark A. Pecora in court, defendant Velda M Brown not in court, in custody.  Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder on behalf of Tyrone St. Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for motion hearing. Defense counsel filed a motion to reconsider the remand ordered entered at the plea date. Arguments heard. Court DENIED defense motion for reasons stated on the record. Case remains scheduled for sentencing on 1/06/16. Case adjourned to Branch 25.

Court ordered a hearing be set to address defendant's motion to reconsider remand. State notified. Case adjourned to 12/16/15 at 8:30 a.m. for Motion Hearing in Branch 25. Per Court, defendant does NOT need to be produced. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
Justice Point Report - Discharge Summary - received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
Defendant's Motion to Reconsider Court Ordered Remand received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
Motion to Reinstate Bail/Bond received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
Victim Impact Statement received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

As to COUNT 2-
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered COUNT 2 dismissed but read in for purposes of sentencing.

Defendant Velda M Brown in court with attorney Mark A. Pecora.  Tyrone Martin St. Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for plea hearing. Parties have reached a resolution. State placed negotiations on the record. 
Defendant sworn in.

As to COUNT 1-
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum, and Jury Instructions received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty.  Judgment of conviction entered.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon she may never possess any gun or other firearms. 
Court advised defendant that her voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until her civil rights are restored.  

Court advised defendant if she is not a citizen of the United States of America, that upon a plea of guilty or no contest for this offense, she could be deported, excluded from admission to her country, or denied naturalization under federal law.  
Court advised that the defendant will have to provide a DNA sample, to the Wisconsin State Crime Laboratory for DNA testing and pay a DNA surcharge.

Court vacated the jury trial date of 12/14/15.
Court ordered the defendant REMANDED into custody.
Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 6, 2016 at 03:30 pm.
Justice Point Report received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

Defense counsel contacted the court to request a projected plea date prior to the jury trial date. Case adjourned to 12/03/15 at 1:30 p.m. for a plea hearing in Branch 25. Case remains scheduled for jury trial on 12/14/15. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
Proposed verdict forms received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
Substantive Jury Instructions received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
State's Requested Jury Instructions received and filed.
State's Witness List received and filed.
State's Motion in Limine received and filed.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection received and filed.
Defendant's Proposed Jury Instructions received and filed.

Defendant Velda M Brown in court with attorney Mark A. Pecora.  Deann Heard for Tyrone Martin St. Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case is court for final pre-trial. Parties have each filed the appropriate final pretrial documents. Any motions requiring testimony will be heard on the jury trial date. Case remains calendared for Jury Trial in Branch 25 on December 14, 2015 at 9:00 a.m.
Filed, Justice Point Report dated 10/21/2015.

Defendant Velda M Brown in court with attorney Mark A. Pecora. Lucy Kronforst on behalf of Tyrone St. Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for plea hearing. Defense counsel is contemplating an NGI plea and requested an adjournment of today's date. Defendant is meeting with the evaluator on 10/01/15. Court granted defense request for adjournment and ordered final pretrial and jury trial dates. Defense counsel to file any documentation related to the NGI plea by 10/09/15. Parties to file motions by 09/18/15. Any motions requiring testimony will be heard on the final pretrial date. Parties to file witness lists, jury instructions, and motions in limine by the final pretrial date. State to file proposed verdict forms and substantive jury instructions by the final pretrial date. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Final pre-trial scheduled for October 22, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for December 14, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Justice Point report received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

Defendant Velda M Brown in court.  Tyrone Martin St. Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for status conference. Judge is out ill today and unable to hear this matter. Attorney Pecora previously advised the Court he would be unable to appear in Court today. Parties still anticipate a resolution in this matter and defense requested an adjourned projected plea date. Defendant given new court date in person. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Plea hearing scheduled for August 31, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Per Court, the defense request to convert the next court date to a status date is granted. State notified. Defense counsel notified the defendant needs to appear in court. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
Letter to the Court from attorney Pecora requesting an adjournment of the next court date received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

Defendant Velda M Brown in court with attorney Mark A. Pecora.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defense counsel requested a plea date.  Parties were advised that as of August 1, 2015, this calendar will be transferred to the Hon. Stephanie G. Rothstein, Branch 25, in Room G-55A of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Court ordered all terms and conditions of bail to continue and ordered case set for projected guilty plea before Branch 25.  Plea hearing scheduled for August 19, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Velda M Brown in court with attorney Mark A Pecora.  Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder for Tyrone St. Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.


Scheduling conference held between counsel.  Parties engaged in settlement negotiations. 
Defense needs additional time to review discovery materials and offer; request for adjourned date granted.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Report, received and filed.

Motion of the defense counsel Douglas Batt to withdraw, is granted by the Court.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 20.

Defendant Velda M Brown in court with attorney Mark A Pecora.  Denis Murphy for Tyrone Martin St. Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Pocan.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Moroney, Br. 20.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Filed, Justice Point Pretrial Report dated 6/16/15.

Attorney Douglas E. Batt in court.  Zachary Wittchow forTyrone Martin St. Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by portable breathalyzers.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Cynthia P.; Doris W.; Arnold M. Lawrence B. or Going to The Dogs Groomers

Defendant Velda M Brown in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Velda M Brown in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Pocan, Branch 26. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Defense entered a plea of NOT GUILTY as to Count 2.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  
  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he/she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he/she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4). 
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 26, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
